meanings.definition: The activity or occupation of keeping records of the financial affairs of a business.
meanings.sent1: Bookkeeping involves recording all the money coming in and going out of a company.
meanings.sent2: In a small business, bookkeeping is essential for tracking expenses and income.
meanings.sent3: The bookkeeping at the bakery was so precise that even the crumbs were accounted for.
meanings.sent4: Her bookkeeping skills were like a well-oiled machine, ensuring every penny was accounted for.
meanings.sent5: The bookkeeping of the antique shop was so detailed, it felt like each coin had its own story.

meanings.definition: The process of recording financial transactions and maintaining financial records.
meanings.sent1: Accurate bookkeeping is crucial for businesses to understand their financial health.
meanings.sent2: Bookkeeping software can streamline the process of managing financial data.
meanings.sent3: The bookkeeping of the company was so organized that even the paper clips had their own section.
meanings.sent4: Her bookkeeping was like a map guiding the company through the maze of financial data.
meanings.sent5: The bookkeeping of the farm was as clear as a sunny day, showing every financial seed planted.
